snippet.title: Walrus Run - Release Date Trailer
snippet.description:
The release date is finally here! Walrus Run will launch on Steam and Itch.io on November 5th, 2024, at 12 AM EST for only $9.99 USD.

Thumbnail Art by The Player https://x.com/TheTweeter500

Walrus Run will have a demo at Supernova 2024! Details: supersmashcon.com
Walrus Run will also have a demo at SAGE 2024! Link to the page will be posted here when the event starts on September 6th.
Walrus Run will be part of October's Steam Next fest, starting October 14th! Check out our Steam page for details. https://store.steampowered.com/app/2687610/Walrus_Run 

Wishlist Walrus Run on Steam! https://store.steampowered.com/app/2687610/Walrus_Run 
Walrus Run is also coming to Itch.io! https://the-jam-games.itch.io/walrus-run 
Join the community on Discord! https://discord.gg/wUHfrAEbgn
Follow The Jam on Twitter for updates! https://twitter.com/TheJam_Games
Visit our website for more information! http://thejam.games

Donate to The Jam!
The Jam's Ko-Fi: https://ko-fi.com/thejam
The Jam's Patreon: https://patreon.com/TheJamGames
Donate here: https://streamelements.com/thejam_games/tip

https://youtu.be/tIMVYHZanq0 Check out our newest Deep Dive video if you want a recap of this trailer's announcements!

Walrus Run is a 2D Action Platformer with a twist...

Progress through 18 levels of platforming action, eating anything that gets in your way! This game is score-based, meaning you get points by moving fast, eating fish, eating enemies, eating... okay, lots of eating.

You lose points if you take too much time, or take damage. There are no health points, meaning you can make as many mistakes as you want and still complete the level, with a shiny new D Rank. Master the levels to get achieve the even shinier S Rank!

This game is compatible with conveniently-shaped bongo controllers! When the game starts, you can choose between "Modern Controls" and "Bongo Controls." Press and hold a bongo pad button for 3 seconds, and BINGO! You can play the entire game with your bongo controller.

But of course, if you don't own such a controller released 20 years ago, you can use modern controllers or keyboard + mouse. You can just pretend you're playing on bongos by mashing the buttons to move. (Yes, you can change this in the settings!)

Walrus Run is the first game released by the brand new indie game studio, The Jam. This game was solo-developed by the company's owner, Eric Callahan. To follow the game's development, you can follow The Jam's Twitter.
